intro: Eremophila incana, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting features such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems to conserve water. Its flowers typically range in color from pale pink to red, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Eremophila incana is often found in sandy soils and is a common component of shrublands and coastal areas.
